```{r}

mls_data <- read.csv("mls-salaries-2007.csv")

```

## What is the approximate salary of a player based on their field position? 






### Model Equation

$$y_i = \beta_0  + \beta_1 x_{1,i} + \epsilon_i$$

with $y = base\_salary$, $x_1 = position$, and $\epsilon_i \sim N(0, \sigma^2)$.









### Fitted Model
```{r}
#| echo: false
#| message: false
#| warning: false
x <- mls_data |> 
  select(club, position, base_salary)

fit_1 <- stan_glm(base_salary ~ position,
                  data = x,
                  family = gaussian,
                  refresh = 0)
fit_1
```


```{r}
#| echo: false
#| message: false
#| warning: false
newobs <- tibble(position = "F")

pe <- posterior_epred(fit_1, newdata = newobs) |> 
  as_tibble() 
```

### Plot
```{r}
#| echo: false
#| message: false
#| warning: false
pe |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = `1`)) +
    geom_histogram(aes(y = after_stat(count/sum(count))),
                   bins = 100)  +
    labs(title = "Posterior for Expected Salary",
         subtitle = "A forward earns around 150,000",
         x = "Forward Position",
         y = "Probability", 
         caption = "Source: Originally from MLS Union") +
    scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::dollar_format()) +
    scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format()) +
    theme_classic()
```
